org.weso.wesearch.domain

Interface Query

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SPARQLQuery

    public interface Query
    This is an interface that represents a template for a query
    Author:
    Ignacio Fuertes Bernardo

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addClause(java.lang.String clause)
      This method adds a new clause to the query.
      void addFilter(java.lang.String varName, Filter filter)
      This method adds a new single filter to the query.
      void addFilters(java.lang.String varName, Filters filter)
      This method adds a set of filters to the query.
      java.lang.String getNextVarName()
      This method returns the name of the next variable that have to be used in the query
      boolean isPropertyForResult()
      This method returns if the next property to add to the query is for the result or for an auxiliary variable
      java.lang.String obtainAuxiliarVarName()
      This method returns the name of the auxiliary variable that it isn't typed
      java.lang.String obtainQuery()
      This method returns a query in a string

    • Method Detail

      • obtainQuery

        java.lang.String obtainQuery()
        This method returns a query in a string
        Returns:
        The string of the query

      • addClause

        void addClause(java.lang.String clause)
        This method adds a new clause to the query. An example of SPARQL clause is "?x rdf:type foaf:Person".
        Parameters:
        clause - The clause to add to the query

      • addFilters

        void addFilters(java.lang.String varName,
              Filters filter)
                throws QueryBuilderException
        This method adds a set of filters to the query. A set of filters is two or more filters separated by an operator. An example of a set of SPARQL filters is "FILTER (xsd:int(?year) = xsd:int ('2010') || xsd:int(?year) = xsd:int('2013') || xsd:int(?year) = xsd:int('2015')) ."
        Parameters:
        varName - The name of the var that must be filtered
        filter - The filters that will be applied over the variable
        Throws:
        QueryBuilderException - This exception is thrown if there is a problem building the query

      • addFilter

        void addFilter(java.lang.String varName,
             Filter filter)
               throws QueryBuilderException
        This method adds a new single filter to the query. A filter is a sentence of the query that limits the values of a variable. An example of SPARQL filter is "FILTER (str(?name) = str("Juan")) ."
        Parameters:
        varName - The name of the var that must be filtered
        filter - The filter that will be applied over the variable
        Throws:
        QueryBuilderException - This exception is thrown if there is a problem building the query

      • getNextVarName

        java.lang.String getNextVarName()
                                throws WesearchException
        This method returns the name of the next variable that have to be used in the query
        Returns:
        The name of the next variable
        Throws:
        WesearchException - This exception is thrown if there is a problem

      • isPropertyForResult

        boolean isPropertyForResult()
        This method returns if the next property to add to the query is for the result or for an auxiliary variable
        Returns:
        A boolean indicates if the next variable is for the result or no

      • obtainAuxiliarVarName

        java.lang.String obtainAuxiliarVarName()
        This method returns the name of the auxiliary variable that it isn't typed
        Returns:
        The name of the auxiliary variable that it isn't typed
